snippet: Several experts said the encounter, in which police shot a man with a knife in Brooklyn, seemed to offer a textbook example of officers following proper procedures for such a situation.
abstract: Police officers who were called when emotionally disturbed man Calvin Peters stabbed student inside Chabad-Lubavitch headquarters responded appropriately to situation and followed training; scenario of mentally unstable person threatening others is common and officers, who cannot always judge person's mental state, must act to protect themselves and others nearby.

byline.original: By AL BAKER and J. DAVID GOODMAN

lead_paragraph: Several experts said the encounter, in which police shot a man with a knife in Brooklyn, seemed to offer a textbook example of officers following proper procedures for such a situation.

headline.main: In Synagogue Shooting, Officers Hewed to Their Training, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: In ‘Common Scenario,’ Officers Followed Training, Officials Say
